definition: the ability to speak clearly and correctly, especially in public and pronouncing the words in a way that is considered to be socially acceptable
to become longer; to make something longer
to become longer; to make something longer
the process of becoming longer or making something longer
able to use language and express your opinions well, especially when you are speaking in public
able to express a feeling
in, at or to another place or other places
thin and weak, usually because of illness or lack of food
to produce or show something
to free somebody, especially from legal, political or social controls that limit what they can do
to free a country or a person from the control of somebody else
to free somebody from something that limits their control over and pleasure in their own life
to prevent a dead body from decaying (= being destroyed by natural processes) by treating it with special substances to preserve it
to make something more beautiful by adding decoration to it
to make a story more interesting by adding details that are not always true
to make something look more attractive by putting things on it
to put paint, wallpaper, etc. on the walls and ceilings of a room or house
to be placed on something in order to make it look more attractive
to give somebody an award or medal as a sign of respect for something they have done
to decorate a dish of food with a small amount of another food
to steal money that you are responsible for or that belongs to your employer
the way that somebody pronounces words
the choice and use of words in literature
to decorate something with a design, a symbol or words so that people will notice it easily
to make somebody feel angry or disappointed about something over a long period of time
a design or picture that represents a country or an organization
something that represents a perfect example or a principle
that represents or is a symbol of something
that is considered typical of a situation, an area of work, etc.
a person or thing that represents or is a typical example of an idea or a quality
to express or represent an idea or a quality
to include or contain something
to make somebody feel braver or more confident
to make a piece of text appear in bold print
to decorate cloth with a pattern of stitches usually using coloured thread
to make a story more interesting by adding details that are not always true
patterns that are sewn onto cloth using threads of various colours; cloth that is decorated in this way
the skill or activity of decorating cloth in this way
to involve somebody/yourself in an argument or a difficult situation
bright green in colour
used before or after a title to show that a person, usually a university teacher, keeps the title as an honour, although he or she has stopped working
making you vomit (= bring up food from the stomach)
to leave your own country to go and live permanently in another country
the act of leaving your own country to go and live permanently in another country
the quality of being famous and respected, especially in a profession
a title used in speaking to or about a cardinal (= a priest of the highest rank in the Roman Catholic Church)
an area of high ground
causing people to feel strong emotions
making a person or situation calmer in the hope of keeping relations peaceful
used for making your skin soft or less painful
an emphatic statement, answer, etc. is given with force to show that it is important
making it very clear what you mean by speaking with force
an emphatic victory, win, or defeat is one in which one team or player wins by a large amount
a condition that affects the lungs, making it difficult to breathe
having the skills and qualifications that will make somebody want to employ you
a person or company that pays people to work for them
a large shop
a shop that sells a particular type of goods
a woman who is the ruler of an empire
the wife of an emperor
a feeling of being sad because nothing seems to have any value
the fact that there is nothing or nobody in a place
a place that is empty
the state of having a hole or empty space inside
the way somebody's face looks when their eyes, cheeks, etc. sink deeply into the face
the quality of making a low sound like that made by an empty object when it is hit
the fact of not being sincere
the fact of being without real value
a large Australian bird that can run fast but cannot fly
if two liquids, one of which is thicker than the other, emulsify or are emulsified, they combine to form a smooth mixture
(in stories) a man who has magic powers that he uses to control people
to surround or cover something completely, especially to protect it
to attract somebody strongly and make them feel very interested, excited, etc.
to place somebody/something under a magic spell (= magic words that have special powers)
the act of encouraging somebody to do something; something that encourages somebody
connected with encyclopedias or the type of information found in them
having a lot of information about a wide variety of subjects; containing complete information about a particular subject

having or needing a lot of energy and enthusiasm

to give somebody more energy, strength, etc.
to supply power or energy to a machine, an atom, etc.
interesting or pleasant in a way that attracts your attention
so interesting that you give it all your attention and time
mysterious and difficult to understand
